comments.body: This doesn't need the `[]()` format as it's a link.
Is this really a prerequisite of kubernetes? isn't this a prereq of docker? what happens if I don't do this?
This is related to issue #9837 . I guess the root-cause is in docker, but the problem is that docker works fine even without this config, but kubernets starts failing to launch the master container.

It's sort of an issue in both?  Docker probably shouldn't be returning a 500 from the remote API in this case, since the docker CLI ignores the error, but the kubelet should also try to workaround this by detecting ahead of time and not passing values (https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/issues/9837#issuecomment-112292120)

I think it's fine to say "kubernetes requires" for now, since it def. is true.
FYI. our containervm kernel doesn't enable swap.
